intro: Draba primuloides, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Draba primuloides is often found in meadows, slopes, and scree areas at high altitudes.
